title.narrative: Denmark's additional core contribution to the APT in 2020

description.narrative: The Danish grant is a core contribution to support the wide range of activities of APT in the context of torture prevention, which will be implemented in accordance with the strategic plan for 2020-2023. In particular, the additional core contribution is granted to enable APT to undertake relevant activities to realise the outcome related to the development of international guidelines on non-coercive interviewing and safeguards, which has previously been funded via project funding.

title.narrative: NPMs are better equipped to conduct gender-sensitive monitoring of detention based on the Bangkok Rules, and are strengthened as a global community of practitioners on the topic.

Number of webinars conducted and number of NPMs participating in webinars. Number of NPMs that have provided inputs (challenges and good practices) to the APT on the implementation of the Bangkok Rules. Number of NPMs that have engaged in the communication campaign on Bangkok Rules 10th anniversary.

target.value: 3 webinars are conducted (in Spanish, French, English). 30 NPMs have participated in webinars from Europe, Latin America and Africa. 30 NPMs from Europe, Latin America and Africa have engaged in the campaign on the 10th anniversary of the Bangkok Rules.

actual.value: 2 webinars organised, with 40 participants from Europe and Latin America. 40 NPMs from Europe, Latin America and Africa have engaged in the campaign on the 10th anniversary of the Bangkok Rules, representing approx. 55% of operational NPMs. 157 members of national oversight bodies are part of the collaborative Slack channel on gender-sensitive detention monitoring. First ever joint submission to the Interamerican Court of Human Rights on practical measures to promote the safety and dignity of LGBTIQ+ persons in detention. Almost all Latin American NPMs and several local mechanisms (12 NPMs out of 14, and 4 LPMs) contributed together to a judicial and regional advisory opinion. Year-long campaign on Women & Prison to make justice safer and fairer for women, launched in December 2020 to mark the 10th anniversary of the UN Bangkok Rules. The APT also produced 4 blogs, 3 videos in 2020 as part of the campaign.

title.narrative: NPMs are better equipped to prevent torture and form a community of torture prevention practitioners.

Number of new learning and practical tools further developed by the APT and made available for NPMs. Number of instances where at least 4 NPMs had exchanged, had synergies, met through networks, learned from peers, etc. with the involvement of the APT.

target.value: 2 tools developed and made available in English, French and Spanish. More than 50 NPMs have received information about the tools available. 7 instances where at least 3 NPMs exchanged, had synergies, met through networks, learned from peers, etc. with the involvement of the APT.

actual.value: 4 tools developed and made available in English, French and Spanish. Because of the impact of the Covid-19 on detention, most of the tools intended to support the work of NPMs in times of Covid-19. They include: Practical guidance on monitoring places of detention in times of COVID-192; 2 digital platforms on Covid-19 and detention (one global and one focusing on Latin America); 3 series of videos “Voices from the filed” (showcasing testimonies of NPMs during the pandemic); 4 podcasts’ series “Perspectives” on the do no harm principle.5 Regional webinar held with African NPM in April 2020; 2 thematic webinars with NPMs in time of Covid in May and June;

title.narrative: The of International Guidelines on non-coercive interviewing and safeguards is finalised and the guidelines are adopted by the Steering Committee
The of International Guidelines on non-coercive interviewing and safeguards is finalised and the guidelines are adopted by the Steering Committee

target.value: - The advisory council has been consulted on the draft of the Guidelines - 1 meeting of the Steering Committee to adopt the draft guidelines - Stakeholder meeting in October/November in Geneva or New-York - Final draft of the guidelines is ready and available for endorsement process

actual.value: The advisory council was consulted twice on the draft Guidelines (now Principles). Series of meetings of the Steering Committee to finalise and adopt the draft guidelines Bilateral meetings with Ambassadors and diplomats in Geneva and distance advocacy through Norway in Vienna (in lieu of the stakeholders’ meeting that could not take place due to Covid-19) Advanced draft of the Principles; final text available in May 2021 and launched in June 2021. Further information on APT website: https://www.apt.ch/en/what-we-do/campaigns/principles-effective-interviewing

title.narrative: Evaluations of the implementation of safeguards in Brazil, Madagascar and Thailand are made.
Number of evidence-based evaluations (both quantitative and qualitative data is collected and analysed).

target.value: 3 evidence-based evaluations measuring the progress made between 2018 and 2020 on the implementation of safeguards in Brazil, Madagascar and Thailand.

actual.value: The evidence-based evaluations on the progress in 2018-2020 regarding the implementation of safeguards in Brazil, Madagascar and Thailand could not be conducted due to Covid-19 restrictions. Instead, an independent evaluation showed important progress in the implementation of safeguards in the 3 countries. In addition, the APT and its partners organised a global webinar (attended by 250 participants) to present the practical lessons learned from that 3-year project in the 3 countries. Finally, a virtual museum with photo exhibition presents the project and its beneficiaries.
